disease: Squamous cell carcinoma of skin of left ear and external auricular canal

symptoms.name: Firm, red nodules and sores
symptoms.pattern: Present on the skin of the ear with scaly crust

physical_findings: Exophytic mass occupying external auditory canal
Minimal pus in external auditory canal
Irregular cauliflower-like uneven neoplasm with stench and yellowish-white discharge
Swollen and movable lymph nodes in right supraclavicular fossa
risk_factors: Skin irritations from ear infections and ear drainage

CT scan: Tumor mass filling right pinna and external auditory canal
Infiltration of right parotid, temporomandibular joint, external auditory canal, and middle ear
Metastasis of right neck lymph node
External auditory canal obliterated by soft tissue mass extending into left middle ear cavity, epitympanum, and mastoid cavity
Inner ear structures and internal auditory canal normal
imaging_findings.MRI scan: May be used to identify location and spread of growth

required: Histopathological examination showing invasive well-differentiated SCC with keratin pearls
supportive: Clinical presentation with ear discharge, pain, hearing loss, tinnitus, and/or bleeding
Imaging findings showing a mass in the external auditory canal and/or temporal bone
